> I'm not sure how to do that. Typically, the name of the test is enough 
> to describe what each test means. Why is that not the case for you?

I'd like to share the result of my unit testing with upper
management-type people.  testInsertTooLargeValue() doesn't mean much
to them.  I'd like a prose description like:  "In this test, we try
inserting a value into the table that is too large.  Depending on such
and such, this should occur.  Or if not, then this should occur.  In
either case, the code finally handlings this use case in blah blah
blah manner."
